answers.answer: You will be put on blood pressure medication to make sure it doesn't rise any further, and depending on how bad you are they can suggest inducing the baby as it can alternatively kill you, I have it and a friend of mine did and she's lucky to be alive, her blood pressure rose when she was in labour and had a epileptic fit, they had to put her in a comer and also cut the baby out. It's not good love lol don't do anything that will stress you out, it's all about keeping calm and relaxed oh they told me I had to stop working but everyone's different,  just ask

They haven't told me I have it yet. Im having to do a 24 hour urine test collecting my urine for an entire 24 hours. Im nervous.  They found protein in my urine and tested me for a uti. I have no uti so now they think it has to be preeclampsia. And im having alot of the symptoms.  Like swelling.  Sudden weight gain. Head aches. And feeling off. I havent been feeling normal for like 3 weeks now.

Im on methadolypa not sure how its spelled 250mg, ,I did the urine last friday and havent got a call back guessing it normal im 6 months my blood pressure is up and down its my first time ever in my life having to take medication good luck:)

I had preclamsia when I went in labor for my first.  It was so high they rushed me upstairs to start me on magnesium.   They were preparing for me to go into seizures.   Very scary stuff.  I had no symptoms,  head aches or anything.

I got it with my first pregnancy, I went to the drs at 37 wks and she put me on bed rest to see if that would help with my bp and it didn't so the following week at my check up she induced the next day. It will all depend on how far a long you are and how high it is.

I got preeclampsia with my first, I was 30 weeks, and they found protein in my urine combined with high blood pressure. I was hospitalised straight away, and put on complete bed rest. I never got given medication for it, but I got 2 steroid shots as they said baby would be coming early. I lasted until 33 weeks and 5 days, and my blood pressure got so high, even while resting, that I had an emergency c section. Once diagnosed, there is no cure, it only gets worse, and once you deliver the baby, all goes back to normal.

I ended up with it. I was actually just induced Thursday at 37 weeks, and also placed on magnesium to keep me from seizing because my BP was so high. I asked God to watch over us both and instantly got a sense of peace. I'm now sitting here looking at my 5 day old princess as I type. With that being said, try not to stress too much, drink plenty of water, and bed rest as much as possible until it's time.  I pray all goes well for you.

I had it in my 7th month with my first and was put in bed rest at home and it was controlled until I delivered... At my 30 week appointment my bp was well above my baseline and had swelling and protein so they are monitoring me as of now because my bp wasnt techniquely high (just high for me) and only slight protein...

I had it with both my previous pregnancies my daughter was 34 weeks and they just delivered they didn't want to put me on bed rest because my BP was so high and with my son I was 36 weeks they tried bed rest at 35 weeks but it didn't help and we ended up delivering

question: Has anyone had or have preeclampsia ?What did they do to you once they found out? Did you need to stop working?  Were you put on bedrest? Did your diet change?
title: preeclampsia
